p: In summary, a series of pyrazole derivatives 3, 6, 8 and 9 bearing different heterocyclic systems was designed and synthesised. All synthesised analogues were examined for their in vitro antimicrobial, DHFR inhibition activity and in silico studies. The antimicrobial data revealed the ability of the compounds 3a and 6a to inhibit the growth of the screened panel of six strains with excellent MIC values in comparison with the reference drugs. In addition, the in vitro inhibitory activity against DHFR enzyme illustrated that compounds 3a and 6a were the most potent ones in comparison with methotrexate. Based on the previously obtained data from DHFR inhibition assay, the pyrazoles 3a and 6a containing sulphonamide substitution illustrated good fitting and favourable binding modes with DHFR enzyme in the docking study through formation of a critical hydrogen bond with the essential amino acid Ser59.
